translated: The Elders’ Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Tamāla-Flower-Fragrance
The Story of the Elder Tinduka-Donor🔽“I was a monkey,
swift and strong, roaming the mountains and the hills.
Seeing a ripe tinduka fruit,
I remembered the best of Buddhas.
After leaving for a few days,🔽I searched for the Leader of the World.

analyzed: pasanna cittaḥ sumanaḥ  siddhattham tibha vantagu
translated: With a confident mind and a happy mind,🔽I remembered the Buddha, the Lord of the Three Worlds.
Understanding my intention,
the unsurpassed Teacher in the world,
together with a thousand of those whose defilements are exhausted,
came to my presence.
Having generated joy,
I approached with the fruit in my hand.🔽The Blessed One, the Omniscient One, the Best of Speakers,
accepted it.
For ninety-four eons,
the fruit I offered then
I do not know of any bad destination,
this is the fruit of offering the fruit.
For fifty-seven eons,
I was named Upananda,
endowed with the seven treasures,
a powerful wheel-turning monarch.
The four analytical knowledges, …
… the Buddha’s instruction has been done.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā tindukadāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā tindukadāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: Thus has the venerable Elder Tinduka-giver recited these verses.
The Story of the Elder Tinduka-giver, the Seventh.
